alert.note: Alert for Bakersfield; Buttonwillow - Lost Hills - I5; Caruthers - San Joaquin - Selma; Delano-Wasco-Shafter; Fresno-Clovis; Hanford - Corcoran - Lemoore; Merced - Madera - Mendota; Planada - Le Grand - Snelling; South End San Joaquin Valley; Southeast San Joaquin Valley; Visalia - Porterville - Reedley; West Side of Fresno and Kings Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Warning issued March 02 at 8:44AM PST until March 03 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 9 AM PST FRIDAY... ...FREEZE WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 9 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures as low as 30 degrees expected. * WHERE...Much of the San Joaquin Valley. * WHEN...The Freeze Warning in effect for today will be allowed to expire at 9 AM this morning. The Freeze Warning for tonight into Friday morning remains in effect from 2 AM PST tonight until 9 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
